decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards, allowing the player to trigger effects that benefit from having cards in the graveyard. This deck focuses on quickly milling itself through cards like Bazaar of Baghdad, Golgari Grave-Troll, and Stinkweed Imp, while also utilizing cards like Hollow One and Ichorid that can be easily cast or brought back from the graveyard for an aggressive game plan. Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection, while Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam provide additional value and damage.

This deck revolves around the key concept of utilizing the Underworld Breach card to form a powerful combo. The goal is to use this card alongside other spells such as Brain Freeze and Timetwister to mill the opponent's deck, effectively removing their resources. The deck also includes essential cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to generate card advantage and gain extra turns, all while utilizing powerful artifacts such as Black Lotus and Moxes to accelerate the deck's strategy. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion, providing additional value and flexibility.

The key concept of this deck is to disrupt and slow down the opponent's game plan using hatebears (such as Archon of Emeria, Chancellor of the Annex, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben) and land destruction (using Strip Mine and Wasteland). The deck also aims to control the opponent's spells and resources through cards like Trinisphere and Cavern of Souls. With these disruptive elements in place, the deck can apply pressure and aggression with efficient creatures (like White Plume Adventurer) to quickly close out the game.

This UW Control deck is built around the key concept of maintaining control over the game through powerful spells and disruptive tactics. The deck utilizes a variety of counterspells, such as Spell Pierce, Flusterstorm, and Force of Will, to stop opponents' plans in their tracks. It also includes cards like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade and Swords to Plowshares to control the board and prevent opponents from building up a threatening board state. Additionally, the deck makes use of powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain card advantage and find the necessary answers.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format. The main objective is to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Vengevine, while utilizing cards like Serum Powder and Bloodghast to maintain card advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements such as Mental Misstep and Chalice of the Void to hinder opponents' strategies. It takes advantage of the Bazaar of Baghdad to fill the graveyard and enable cards like Life from the Loam and Hollow One. Overall, the key concept is to overwhelm opponents with fast and efficient creatures while disrupting their game plan.

This deck revolves around the combination of cards that enables the player to win the game in a single turn. The key cards include Doomsday, which sets up the win condition, along with Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation. The deck utilizes powerful card draw and filtering abilities, such as Ancestral Recall, Gush, and Brainstorm, to find the necessary pieces quickly. It also includes counter spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The deck aims to create a winning board state by carefully sequencing and utilizing the resources available.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and card draw to achieve a powerful combo. It includes cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Coveted Jewel to generate card advantage and mana. It also features artifacts such as Time Vault and Tinker to control the game and create advantageous situations. Additionally, it uses cards like Phyrexian Metamorph and Grim Monolith to generate mana and accelerate the combo. With access to powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Mox cards, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overpower the opponent.

This deck is built around the companion card Lurrus of the Dream-Den, which allows the player to cast permanents with converted mana cost 2 or less from their graveyard. The key concept of the deck is to control the opponent's actions and disrupt their game plan by using counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, removal spells like Swords to Plowshares, and land destruction with Wasteland. The deck also utilizes card draw and selection with cards like Mishra's Bauble, Brainstorm, and Dig Through Time. Lavinia, Azorius Renegade is another key card that disrupts the opponent's mana base and shuts down certain strategies.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the Paradoxical Outcome card to generate massive amounts of mana and card advantage. The deck includes a combination of fast mana artifacts like Sol Ring, Moxen, and Mana Crypt, as well as powerful card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Brainstorm. It also includes a suite of restricted cards like Timewalk and Black Lotus to further accelerate the deck's game plan. By bouncing a variety of artifacts and generating large amounts of mana, the deck can combo off and win the game, potentially using Brain Freeze as a win condition.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities and hate cards to control the opponent's strategy and board state. The deck aims to quickly deploy a mix of hatebears like Archon of Emeria, White Plume Adventurer, and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while also disrupting the opponent's mana with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine. Additionally, the deck includes powerful accelerants like Chrome Mox and the Moxen to quickly apply pressure. Overall, the deck seeks to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while presenting a fast and aggressive clock.

The key concept of this deck is to create a disruptive and aggressive strategy using hatebears. The deck aims to prevent opponents from playing their spells effectively by utilizing cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex. It also has elements of artifact ramp with cards like Chrome Mox and Moxes, which allows for faster deployment of creatures and disruption. Additionally, the deck includes tools for generating card advantage and potentially overwhelming the opponent with Seasoned Dungeoneer and White Plume Adventurer. Overall, the deck combines aggressive creatures with disruptive elements to control the game and secure an advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control over the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage while leveraging the power of the Dimir Control archetype. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and tempo with cards like Force of Will and Wasteland, while also using card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time to maintain a steady stream of resources. Additionally, the deck includes powerful artifacts such as Time Vault and Moxen to generate additional mana and create advantageous board states.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combo potential of Paradoxical Outcome along with various artifact cards to generate card advantage and mana acceleration. The deck aims to quickly assemble powerful artifacts such as Time Vault and the Mox cards, while also utilizing card draw effects like Ancestral Recall and Urza's Saga to maintain a strong hand size. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will to protect your combo pieces and maintain control of the game. The goal is to create an overwhelming advantage through artifact synergy and efficient mana usage.

This Vintage Aggro - Fish deck focuses on quickly applying early pressure and disrupting opponents with efficient creatures and disruptive spells. It uses cards like Expressive Iteration and Brainstorm to dig for key threats, while also utilizing cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its game plan. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional recursion and value. The mana base is composed of various fetchlands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

This Vintage UW Control deck focuses on countering and disrupting the opponent's plans while maintaining card advantage. It uses powerful control spells like Force of Will, Force of Negation, and Daze to counter threats, and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to lock down the opponent's mana. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Strip Mine and Wasteland to destroy opposing lands. It utilizes card draw and selection with Ancestral Recall, Dig Through Time, Brainstorm, and Ponder to find important answers. The deck aims to control the game while gradually grinding down the opponent's resources and securing victory.

The key concept of this deck revolves around control and disruption. The deck aims to control the board state and the opponent's actions through counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation, while also utilizing cards like Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to restrict the opponent's ability to play certain spells. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Mental Misstep and Flusterstorm to further disrupt the opponent's plans. Additionally, the deck includes a combo element with Lurrus of the Dream-Den as the companion, allowing for recurring value from the graveyard.
